column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////The pizza itself was pretty good. They're know for their butter crust which was the most interesting part. We got the Classic and it had sausage
column3: cheese and lots of tomato sauce. Overall
column4: it was crunchy on the edges
column6: piping hot and amazing on the top. The medium doesn't look like a lot when it comes out but after two slices I was stuffed. I also got a bowl of their minestrone soup which was very well made. Full of beans and lots of spices. This place is definitely worth a try if you're in Chicago but I wouldn't go back again just to have their pizza.
